poem:
**Contagion's Return**

In shadows where the past lies,  
A silent whisper breaks,  
Measles, crimson echoes rise  
On whispers, fever, aches.  
The land, unguarded, bleeds again,  
Old ghosts return to seek,  
A dance of spots on fragile skin,  
A tale the bones still speak.  
In vigilance, truth reigns to mend,  
Yet time repeats the ache.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Measles outbreak: how contagious is it and what are the symptoms? Twenty-five years ago, the US eliminated the measles virus. Measles is extremely contagious, and sporadic cases and outbreaks are expected. But as of 2 May, 683 cases have been confirmed since January, primarily in west Texas. New Mexico, Oklahoma, Kansas and other states have also reported cases. There have been three confirmed deaths from measles in the US, according to the CDC. That includes". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
